WRITING.TEXT: In legal terms, as defined under our Constitution, Trump is about to become the legitimate president. He won the majority of votes in the Electoral College, at which point the ballgame was over. [...] In terms of his political legitimacy, however, Trump is on shakier ground. Partly because this is a vaguer concept, but mostly because a presidents perceived legitimacy stems from a couple of different sources. For one, political legitimacy comes from opposing lawmakers recognizing it, and from that same group treating this recognition as one of those unwritten political norms that has long kept our democracy functioning. Republicans in particular have tossed this norm right out the window over the last eight years by adopting a scorched-earth tactic of opposition to President Obama at every turn.[...] Trumps political legitimacy is also at issue due to his enormous deficit in the popular vote. Even if that vote does not count in terms of deciding the winner, the wide gap between its results and those of the Electoral College should make clear and would do so, were Trump not a malignant narcissist that our incoming government represents a minority of Americans, and is therefore contrary to the spirit of democracy we are being asked to celebrate this weekend when Trump is inaugurated.

WRITING.TITLE: Is Donald Trump a legitimate president? Yes and no it depends what we mean by that

Paul Ryan invited Donald Trumps most senior advisers to Capitol Hill a week ago to head off a quiet tug-of-war between congressional Republicans and Trump officials over tax reform. For more than two hours, the speaker laid out his alternative to Trumps plan to slap tariffs on companies that move jobs overseas, which he believed would encourage companies to stay in the U.S. But not even a week later, Trump dismissed Ryans idea, calling it *too complicated.* And now Ryan is left with a potential trillion-dollars hole in his tax plan.

WRITING.TEXT: Marling: Hap was a difficult character. Zal and I must have written 20 different character background or profiles for him: from this place, from that place, this kind of father, that kind of mother, over and over and over. The thing that finally cracked Hap was this idea of someone whos deeply sensitive to sound. When you first see him in the beginning, he has his earplugs in Grand Central Station, and you can tell that the cacophony of the subway to him is overwhelming.
Maybe someone should tell him that the presidency is a full time job, not Mon-Fri 9 to 5 type!
Actually this was Sen. James Lankford, a member of the Select Committee on Intelligence.

"I don't see them working against Donald Trump," the Oklahoma senator and member of the Select Committee on Intelligence said on the "Kilmeade and Friends" radio program. "They may agree or disagree with policy directions that he wants to take, but the people that I've interacted with, I haven't seen anyone in that community that's working against Donald Trump."

WRITING.TITLE: GOP senator: Intelligence community is not working against Trump

WRITING.TEXT:
What you're referring to didn't come from the Trump dossier. The task force was created after a Baltic State intelligence agency intercepted a call between the Russians and Trump's team, they passed on the info to the CIA.
Regarding the Trump dossier itself this is what Christopher Steele said in an interview with the [Independent](http://www.independent.co.uk/news/world/americas/donald-trump-russia-dossier-file-investigation-hacking-christopher-steele-mi6-a7526901.html) about the FBI:
Mr Steele also decided to pass on information to both British and American intelligence officials after concluding that such material should not just be in the hands of political opponents of Mr Trump, who had hired his services, but was a matter of national security for both countries. However, say security sources, Mr Steele became increasingly frustrated that the FBI was failing to take action on the intelligence from others as well as him. He came to believe there was a cover-up, that a cabal within the Bureau blocked a thorough inquiry into Mr Trump, focusing instead on the investigation into Hillary Clintons emails.

The BBC and other sources reported that the FBI was dragging their feet investigating the Trump dossier, specially the allegations regarding contacts between Trump's team and Russian operatives. After the circulation of the dossier among Washington insiders and the media, they were forced to address it.
The Sith Lord strikes back!
Yeah, the FBI is sure looking after their favorite candidate!
And the madness of King Trump continues!
It's prehistoric!

What foreign TV series are you watching?
WRITING.TEXT:
I think that one of the benefits of streaming services is having the opportunity to watch foreign shows, and movies, that are otherwise unavailable on TV.
So far I watched French series (Spiral, The Returned, Braquo and Witnesses), an Italian series (1992), two Norwegian shows (Occupied and Nobel) and three Israeli shows (Prisoners of War, Mossad 101 and Fauda).
